alert.note: Alert for Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 27 at 6:40PM PDT until March 28 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. Winds gusting 30 to 45 mph. * WHERE...Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties including MacDoel and Newell as well as portions of Highways 97 and 139. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 5 PM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snowfall is expected Tuesday morning. The combination of gusty winds and snow will result in reduced visibilities. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties
